column1: For TRAM surgery: - The surgeon makes a cut (incision) across your lower belly, from one hip to the other.
For a gluteal flap: - The surgeon makes a cut in your buttocks.
For a TUG flap: - The surgeon makes a cut in your thigh.
When breast reconstruction is done at the same time as a mastectomy, the entire surgery may last 8 to 10 hours.
The advantage of breast reconstruction with natural tissue is that the remade breast is softer and more natural than breast implants.
You will usually spend 2 or 3 more days in the hospital after this surgery compared to other reconstruction procedures.

Risks of anesthesia and surgery are: - Reactions to medicines - Breathing problems - Bleeding, blood clots, or infection Risks of breast reconstruction with natural tissue are: - Loss of sensation around the nipple and areola - Noticeable scar - One breast is larger than the other (asymmetry of the breasts) - Loss of the flap because of problems with blood supply, requiring more surgery to save the flap or to remove it - Bleeding into the area where the breast used to be, sometimes requiring a second surgery to control the bleeding
